exercises.title: Thought Record (L1)
exercises.summary: Catch the thought, test evidence, craft a balanced reframe.
steps: Describe the situation in one sentence. (Want deeper peace? Try praying: 'Lord, help me see this clearly.')
Write your automatic thought. (Consider: What would God say about this? 'For God hath not given us the spirit of fear.')
Rate emotion 1–10. (Need calm? 'Be still, and know that I am God.' - Psalm 46:10)
List 2 pieces of evidence for and 2 against. (Seek truth: 'Whatsoever things are true... think on these things.' - Philippians 4:8)
Write a balanced alternative thought. (Want wisdom? 'If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God.' - James 1:5)
Rate your emotion again 1–10. (Feeling better? 'The peace of God... shall keep your hearts and minds.' - Philippians 4:7)
What would you tell a friend in this situation? (Share hope: 'For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the LORD, thoughts of peace.' - Jeremiah 29:11)
Go deeper: How does this connect to your values? (Want purpose? 'Seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness.' - Matthew 6:33)
stepsFaith: Describe the situation in one sentence. (Pray: 'Lord, help me see this clearly.')
Write your automatic thought. (Consider: 'What would God say about this?')
List 2 pieces of evidence for and 2 against. (Ask: 'What does Scripture say?')
Write a balanced alternative thought. (Pray: 'Help me think like Christ.')
Rate your emotion again 1–10. (Thank God for His peace.)
What would you tell a friend in this situation? (Share God's truth with them.)
Go deeper: How does this connect to your values? (Pray: 'Align my heart with Yours, Lord.')
exercises.petersonAimUp: Order your thinking, then your day.

exercises.title: Breathing 60s (L1)
exercises.summary: Steady your physiology: inhale 4, hold 4, exhale 4, hold 4.
steps: Inhale 4 (Want deeper calm? 'The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.' - Psalm 23:1)
Hold 4 (Need peace? 'Be still, and know that I am God.' - Psalm 46:10)
Exhale 4 (Release worry: 'Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.' - 1 Peter 5:7)
Hold 4 (Rest in hope: 'In his presence is fullness of joy.' - Psalm 16:11)

Hold 4 (Meditate: 'Be still and know that I am God.')
Exhale 4 (Release: 'Cast all your anxiety on Him.')
Hold 4 (Rest: 'In His presence is fullness of joy.')

exercises.title: Values Clarification (L1)
exercises.summary: Pick 5 values, star your top 2, note one misalignment.
steps: Choose 5 values that matter today. (Want deeper purpose? 'Seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness.' - Matthew 6:33)
Star your top 2. (Which align with God's heart? 'Love the Lord your God with all your heart.' - Matthew 22:37)
Name one area out of alignment. (Need help? 'If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us.' - 1 John 1:9)
One tiny step to realign today. (Want strength? 'I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.' - Philippians 4:13)
stepsFaith: Choose 5 values that matter today. (Pray: 'Lord, show me what You value.')
Star your top 2. (Ask: 'Which align with God's heart?')
Name one area out of alignment. (Confess: 'Lord, I need Your help here.')
One tiny step to realign today. (Pray: 'Give me strength to obey.')

exercises.title: If–Then Plan (L1)

steps: Name a likely obstacle. (Want wisdom? 'If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God.' - James 1:5)
If ___ happens, then I will ___ (specific, tiny). (Need strength? 'I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.' - Philippians 4:13)
Schedule it today or tomorrow. (Want guidance? 'Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.' - Proverbs 3:5)
